item.title: Newly planted tree seems to be struggling, 6th July
item.description:
The newly planted Amelanchier outside no 6 & 8 Widmore Lodge Road appears to be struggling with leaves missing off the top branches, as well as the edges of some of the leaves browning. I have scanned the QR code but it gives me no information as I can’t open it. I have been watering the tree during the hot weather but worry whether I’m under or over watering. A visit or advice would be most welcome as it would be a shame to lose the tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Lodge Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 56a Chesterfield Grove Continous Fly Tipping, 6th July
item.description:
The residence continues to fly tip and not place their rubbish where it is supposed to go or have it collected in the appropriate manner. The microwave has been there from Thursday 3rd July 2025. This causes an obstruction on the pathway leading to health and safety concerns. In addition to it being an elecrrical item. Please can something be done for this conduct to stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Ashbourne Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass in fountains, 6th July
item.description:
